subject: Ethics
title: Dignity and Private Space
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Dignity and Private Space.

hook.text: Why do bathrooms have doors? Not because what happens inside is shameful. Because dignity requires boundaries.

buildup.text: Philosopher James Rachels argued privacy lets us maintain different relationships with different people.

discovery.text: You share different things with your doctor, boss, and best friend. Each relationship needs its own boundary.

twist.text: When data is visible to all, those boundaries collapse. Your boss sees your health info. Your date sees your debt.

climax.text: A society without private space isn't more honest â€” it's one where everyone performs for every audience at once.

punchline.text: Privacy is the architecture of human dignity.

quiz.question: Why does philosopher James Rachels say privacy is essential?
options: It prevents all crime and dishonesty
It allows us to maintain distinct relationships with different people
